title: Amazon Prime Day: 130+ Extended Prime Day Deals Still Available to Shop Right Now
description: October Prime Day might be in the rear view, but a ton of great deals are still alive and kicking. We got all the best deals still up for grabs right here.
author: Adam Oram
byline: Adam Oram, Aashna Gheewalla, Oliver Haslam
excerpt: October Prime Day might be in the rear view, but a ton of great deals are still alive and kicking. We got all the best deals still up for grabs right here.
text: October's iteration of Amazon Prime Day is officially behind us, but an array of incredible post-Prime Day deals are still available on everything from gaming consoles to TVs, headphones, laptops and more. There are other ways to save as well, but you'll need to be quick. This is your last chance to get in on the Prime Visa credit card. It'll get you up to 7% cashback on Amazon.com purchases with no-rush shipping. Additionally, the Prime Visa card gets you an instant $150 Amazon gift card that you can use immediately on some of the best deals.Our team of shopping experts will keep scouring all the savings still to be had so you can snag all the best post-Prime Day deals before time runs out.Looking for something on a specific budget? Take a look at our updated roundups of post-Prime Day discounts under $100 or even under $50 to get exactly what you're looking for while you still can. Best October Prime Day Deals That Are Still Available Beats/CNET Although a generation old, the Beats Solo3 is still one of the best headphones around, thanks to the 40-hour battery life and respectable sound quality. Right now you can get a pair for half the usual price. Get not one but two USB-C chargers with two cables included for just $13 with this Prime Day deal. Each charger has a 20-watt USB-C port, which is enough for fast-charging the latest iPhones. A legacy USB-A port is also included for folks who need it, meaning you can charge more than one device at a time. Watch this: How to Hack Amazon Prime Day: Shopping and Deals Advice 04:03 What are Prime Big Deal Days?Amazon's October Prime Day event is officially called Prime Big Deal Days, but the shopping extravaganza essentially functions as a second Amazon Prime Day event ahead of the holiday season. If you've never shopped during a Prime Day sale before, you might be wondering exactly what it entails, so here's a brief explainer. It's a two-day Amazon sale that offers exclusive savings to Amazon Prime subscribers with limited-time offers, flash deals and rock-bottom prices. It's a rare chance to score Black Friday-level pricing outside of November, so it's usually well worth shopping. The Prime Big Deal Days event took place this year on Oct. 8 and 9. However, some deals are lingering on a little past the official end of the sale. When is Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days 2024 event? Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days were held on Oct. 8 to Oct. 9 this year. Generally speaking, most deals ended at midnight on Oct. 9 this time around. Some deals have lingered beyond the set times of the sale event, but they could end at any time.As you can see from the history of Prime Day dates below, Amazon has held its Prime Day sales each July, with just a couple of deviations from that regular schedule. Notably, in 2020, Amazon pushed its Prime Day sale to October due to the COVID-19 pandemic, before returning the sale to the summer in 2021 in a slightly earlier June spot. Prime Day returned to its July slot for 2022, although Amazon did use October once again for an additional Prime Early Access Sale event that acted as a kickoff to the holiday shopping season. Last year, it was the same July-October pattern, but Amazon also added a new (not Prime-exclusive) sale for 2024 with the inaugural Amazon Big Spring Sale. As a reference, here are the Prime Day dates from previous years and including this year's events: Prime Day 2015: July 15Prime Day 2016: July 12.Prime Day 2017: July 11 to 12 (first to last longer than one day)Prime Day 2018: July 16 to 17Prime Day 2019: July 15 to 16.Prime Day 2020: Oct. 13 to 14 (delayed by COVID-19 pandemic)Prime Day 2021: June 21 to 22 (the earliest to date)Prime Day 2022: July 12 to 13Prime Early Access Sale 2022: Oct. 11 to 12Prime Day 2023: July 11 to 12Prime Big Deal Days 2023: Oct. 10 to 11Amazon Big Spring Sale: March 20 to 25Prime Day 2024: July 16 to 17Prime Big Deal Days 2024: Oct. 8 to Oct 9 Have other retailers launched anti-Prime Deal Days sales? Each Prime Day event brings with it other retailers announcing sales that directly compete with Amazon's event, and it's no different this October, either. We've seen other retailers launch sales -- like Walmart's Holiday Deals event and Best Buy's anti-Prime sales -- providing plenty of options to choose from.  Are Amazon Prime Deal Days deals worth buying?In short, yes. Thousands of items see price reductions during the event, with some of the deals returning to or reaching all-time low prices. Because there is no telling how much inventory is available or how long the price cuts will last, you'll want to act quickly under those circumstances. Extend Amazon Prime Day Savings With These Shopping Tips See all photos Does Prime Day happen twice a year?Looking at past years, there has been a second Prime Day-style sale in October for the past two years now. It started in 2022 as the Prime Day Early Access sale. In 2023, the trend continued with the Prime Big Deal Days sale, and Amazon has once again utilized this spot on the calendar for a Prime Day sale on Oct. 8 and 9. What's the difference between Prime Big Deal Days vs. Prime Day? There are lots of similarities between the two sales. Many of the same deals return during the October sale, especially on Amazon's own devices, such as Blink and Ring home security devices, Fire TVs and tablets, Echo devices and more. The main difference is related to the timing of the sale. Since July Prime Day is in the summer, there's more focus on back-to-school and outdoor deals. This includes school supplies, grills, lawnmowers and more. During October Prime Day, we see more deals geared toward the upcoming holiday season, such as kitchenware for a Thanksgiving meal or kids' toys and games for Christmas. It's a great time to grab Christmas gifts ahead of the holiday rush. How does Prime Big Deal Days work? The idea behind the sale is pretty simple: Subscribers to Amazon's Prime service can get exclusive discounts on thousands of products and services across the site during a limited period. The products, while still available to non-Prime members, will have extra savings for members, with many prices dropping down to new all-time lows. When you're logged in to your Prime account and looking at a product landing page, you'll see the discounted price if it's on sale. You don't need any special coupon codes, nor is there a need to use a specific payment method to get the discounts. If you spend your money wisely each year, you can easily make back your Prime membership cost in savings during the event. What products go on sale for Prime Big Deal Days? Since Amazon sells pretty much everything, its Prime Big Deal Days bonanza features deals on pretty much everything too. Whether you're shopping for tech, kitchen gear, outdoor furniture or everyday essentials, October Prime Day should offer something in the way of savings for you. In past sale events, some of the best savings have been on Amazon devices. This includes Kindle readers, Echo speakers, Fire TVs and more. It's not just Amazon's own brands that see steep discounts. During the sale you will be able to grab great deals across a variety of big-name brands, including significant savings on items like laptops, TVs and fitness gear, to name a few. Do Prime deals change throughout the day? Unfortunately, yes. All the deals we listed here, and the rest of the deals on Amazon, are subject to change at any given time before, after and even during the sale event. Here at CNET, we're constantly going through our pages to make sure that they are updated with the latest prices. However, since prices can change at any time if you see something you like, we recommend buying it as soon as possible before the price changes, the deal expires or the item becomes unavailable.  Do you need to be an Amazon Prime member to shop Prime Big Deal Days deals? Yes, Amazon's Prime Deal Days sale requires a Prime subscription if you want to nab any of the Prime-exclusive deals. You don't have to be a paying subscriber, as long as the event falls within your Prime trial period. That means you can start your monthlong trial just before the event and get in on the savings for free. For more info on that, check out our guide to getting Amazon Prime perks without paying for a subscription. Do Prime Big Deal Days deals last both days? Some will, others won't. New deals get added regularly, and old ones sell out or get changed. Our CNET experts monitored the sale to keep this page updated throughout the event as deals expired or any new finds cropped up, and though the event has officially ended for 2024, we're still updating this page with the Prime Day deals still remaining, so keep checking back.  Where can I find the best October Prime Day Deals still available? The CNET Deals team covers all of the best price drops, discounts and deals daily from all the top retailers. Whether it's a one-day promo at Woot, a weekend sale at Best Buy or a coupon code for a product at Amazon, if it's a great deal, we'll be covering it. Best October Prime Day deals still available by category Best members-only Prime Day dealsBest laptop dealsBest TV dealsBest tablet dealsBest Apple dealsBest gaming dealsBest monitor dealsBest headphone dealsBest kitchen appliance dealsBest Amazon device dealsBest fitness tracker dealsBest soundbar dealsBest graphics card dealsBest Roku dealsBest robot vacuum deals  Best October Prime Day deals still available by price Best deals under $10Best deals under $25Best deals under $50Best deals under $100Best anti-Prime Day deals still available from other retailers this week Best Best Buy dealsBest Walmart dealsBe sure to check out all of the great deals each day at CNET.com/deals and sign up for our CNET Cheapskate newsletter for a daily digest of deals delivered to your inbox. You can also sign up for CNET Deals text alerts for curated deals during the event, and install our CNET Shopping browser extension to help ensure that purchases you make all year round will be at the lowest price available.

October's iteration of Amazon Prime Day is officially behind us, but an array of incredible post-Prime Day deals are still available on everything from gaming consoles to TVs, headphones, laptops and more. There are other ways to save as well, but you'll need to be quick. This is your last chance to get in on the Prime Visa credit card. It'll get you up to 7% cashback on Amazon.com purchases with no-rush shipping. Additionally, the Prime Visa card gets you an instant $150 Amazon gift card that you can use immediately on some of the best deals.

Our team of shopping experts will keep scouring all the savings still to be had so you can snag all the best post-Prime Day deals before time runs out.

Looking for something on a specific budget? Take a look at our updated roundups of post-Prime Day discounts under $100 or even under $50 to get exactly what you're looking for while you still can.

Best October Prime Day Deals That Are Still Available

Although a generation old, the Beats Solo3 is still one of the best headphones around, thanks to the 40-hour battery life and respectable sound quality. Right now you can get a pair for half the usual price.

Get not one but two USB-C chargers with two cables included for just $13 with this Prime Day deal. Each charger has a 20-watt USB-C port, which is enough for fast-charging the latest iPhones. A legacy USB-A port is also included for folks who need it, meaning you can charge more than one device at a time.

Apple's latest AirPods Pro feature the latest H2 chip, active noise cancellation, personalized spatial audio, and more. These are the best wireless earbuds that Apple has ever made and now you can pick them up for $190 during Amazon Prime Day.

The ECOFLOW Delta 2 Max can charge up to 80% in under 45 minutes, and power almost any appliance with up to 2400W of output. Between the 15 outlets and solar charging capabilities, the ECOFLOW Delta 2 Max is an excellent power backup solution against outages or for camping. Note you do need to be a Prime member to get the best price, though.

Get one of the popular Stanley tumblers to keep your cold drinks cold and your hot drinks hot. This model is dishwasher safe, has double-wall vacuum insulation and has a flip straw lid for added convenience. 

Nifty new items available now

Major fans of Nintendo and Disney are in for a treat with these cool new gadgets. These just-released items could be great gifts for the holidays, or snag them for yourself!

Nintendo surprised everyone with a neat new product, and we'd be remiss if we didn't tell you all about Alarmo. The Nintendo Sound Clock comes equipped with Nintendo themes including animations, sounds and characters from popular games to help you start your day right. It even has motion tracking capabilities to detect when you're out of bed (and more). Just keep in mind that you must be a paid Nintendo Switch Online member to score one. 

Released on day one of this year's October Prime Day event, this Jack Skellington bundle comes with a 5th gen Echo Dot and a wickedly cool Jack Skellington cover. Ask Alexa questions about the news, weather or ask her to play music -- maybe during your Halloween party with this festive design.

Best Prime Day TV deals from Sony, Amazon, Insignia and more

Whether you're looking for a new upgrade for your home theater or a simple TV for your new apartment, there's something for everyone. You'll even find Prime Day TV deals still available on some of our top-rated models.  

TCL's 75-inch Mini LED panel is great for watching movies, but it's also amazing for gamers with its 240Hz refresh rate. This display even supports Dolby Vision IQ HDR, Dolby Atmos and built-in Alexa features, as well as the Google TV platform.

This TV has a sizable 65-inch display and comes with built-in 4K, HLG, HDR 10 and Dolby Digital Plus, giving you the most immersive images and sound. 

With an OLED screen, gaming features and Dolby Atmos sound with object tracking, this is an impressive model for theatrical experiences at home.

Best Prime Day home and kitchen deals on vacuums, coffee makers and more

What are Prime Big Deal Days?

Amazon's October Prime Day event is officially called Prime Big Deal Days, but the shopping extravaganza essentially functions as a second Amazon Prime Day event ahead of the holiday season. If you've never shopped during a Prime Day sale before, you might be wondering exactly what it entails, so here's a brief explainer. It's a two-day Amazon sale that offers exclusive savings to Amazon Prime subscribers with limited-time offers, flash deals and rock-bottom prices. It's a rare chance to score Black Friday-level pricing outside of November, so it's usually well worth shopping. The Prime Big Deal Days event took place this year on Oct. 8 and 9. However, some deals are lingering on a little past the official end of the sale.

When is Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days 2024 event?

Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days were held on Oct. 8 to Oct. 9 this year. Generally speaking, most deals ended at midnight on Oct. 9 this time around. Some deals have lingered beyond the set times of the sale event, but they could end at any time.

As you can see from the history of Prime Day dates below, Amazon has held its Prime Day sales each July, with just a couple of deviations from that regular schedule. Notably, in 2020, Amazon pushed its Prime Day sale to October due to the COVID-19 pandemic, before returning the sale to the summer in 2021 in a slightly earlier June spot. Prime Day returned to its July slot for 2022, although Amazon did use October once again for an additional Prime Early Access Sale event that acted as a kickoff to the holiday shopping season. Last year, it was the same July-October pattern, but Amazon also added a new (not Prime-exclusive) sale for 2024 with the inaugural Amazon Big Spring Sale.

As a reference, here are the Prime Day dates from previous years and including this year's events:

  • Prime Day 2015: July 15
  • Prime Day 2016: July 12.
  • Prime Day 2017: July 11 to 12 (first to last longer than one day)
  • Prime Day 2018: July 16 to 17
  • Prime Day 2019: July 15 to 16.
  • Prime Day 2020: Oct. 13 to 14 (delayed by COVID-19 pandemic)
  • Prime Day 2021: June 21 to 22 (the earliest to date)
  • Prime Day 2022: July 12 to 13
  • Prime Early Access Sale 2022: Oct. 11 to 12
  • Prime Day 2023: July 11 to 12
  • Prime Big Deal Days 2023: Oct. 10 to 11
  • Amazon Big Spring Sale: March 20 to 25
  • Prime Day 2024: July 16 to 17
  • Prime Big Deal Days 2024: Oct. 8 to Oct 9

Have other retailers launched anti-Prime Deal Days sales?

Each Prime Day event brings with it other retailers announcing sales that directly compete with Amazon's event, and it's no different this October, either. We've seen other retailers launch sales -- like Walmart's Holiday Deals event and Best Buy's anti-Prime sales -- providing plenty of options to choose from. 

Are Amazon Prime Deal Days deals worth buying?

In short, yes. Thousands of items see price reductions during the event, with some of the deals returning to or reaching all-time low prices. Because there is no telling how much inventory is available or how long the price cuts will last, you'll want to act quickly under those circumstances.

Extend Amazon Prime Day Savings With These Shopping Tips

See all photos

Does Prime Day happen twice a year?

Looking at past years, there has been a second Prime Day-style sale in October for the past two years now. It started in 2022 as the Prime Day Early Access sale. In 2023, the trend continued with the Prime Big Deal Days sale, and Amazon has once again utilized this spot on the calendar for a Prime Day sale on Oct. 8 and 9.

What's the difference between Prime Big Deal Days vs. Prime Day?

There are lots of similarities between the two sales. Many of the same deals return during the October sale, especially on Amazon's own devices, such as Blink and Ring home security devices, Fire TVs and tablets, Echo devices and more.

The main difference is related to the timing of the sale. Since July Prime Day is in the summer, there's more focus on back-to-school and outdoor deals. This includes school supplies, grills, lawnmowers and more. During October Prime Day, we see more deals geared toward the upcoming holiday season, such as kitchenware for a Thanksgiving meal or kids' toys and games for Christmas. It's a great time to grab Christmas gifts ahead of the holiday rush.

How does Prime Big Deal Days work?

The idea behind the sale is pretty simple: Subscribers to Amazon's Prime service can get exclusive discounts on thousands of products and services across the site during a limited period. The products, while still available to non-Prime members, will have extra savings for members, with many prices dropping down to new all-time lows.

When you're logged in to your Prime account and looking at a product landing page, you'll see the discounted price if it's on sale. You don't need any special coupon codes, nor is there a need to use a specific payment method to get the discounts. If you spend your money wisely each year, you can easily make back your Prime membership cost in savings during the event.

What products go on sale for Prime Big Deal Days?

Since Amazon sells pretty much everything, its Prime Big Deal Days bonanza features deals on pretty much everything too. Whether you're shopping for tech, kitchen gear, outdoor furniture or everyday essentials, October Prime Day should offer something in the way of savings for you.

In past sale events, some of the best savings have been on Amazon devices. This includes Kindle readers, Echo speakers, Fire TVs and more. It's not just Amazon's own brands that see steep discounts. During the sale you will be able to grab great deals across a variety of big-name brands, including significant savings on items like laptops, TVs and fitness gear, to name a few.

Do Prime deals change throughout the day?

Unfortunately, yes. All the deals we listed here, and the rest of the deals on Amazon, are subject to change at any given time before, after and even during the sale event. Here at CNET, we're constantly going through our pages to make sure that they are updated with the latest prices. However, since prices can change at any time if you see something you like, we recommend buying it as soon as possible before the price changes, the deal expires or the item becomes unavailable. 

Do you need to be an Amazon Prime member to shop Prime Big Deal Days deals?

Yes, Amazon's Prime Deal Days sale requires a Prime subscription if you want to nab any of the Prime-exclusive deals. You don't have to be a paying subscriber, as long as the event falls within your Prime trial period. That means you can start your monthlong trial just before the event and get in on the savings for free. For more info on that, check out our guide to getting Amazon Prime perks without paying for a subscription.

Do Prime Big Deal Days deals last both days? 

Some will, others won't. New deals get added regularly, and old ones sell out or get changed. Our CNET experts monitored the sale to keep this page updated throughout the event as deals expired or any new finds cropped up, and though the event has officially ended for 2024, we're still updating this page with the Prime Day deals still remaining, so keep checking back. 

Where can I find the best October Prime Day Deals still available?

The CNET Deals team covers all of the best price drops, discounts and deals daily from all the top retailers. Whether it's a one-day promo at Woot, a weekend sale at Best Buy or a coupon code for a product at Amazon, if it's a great deal, we'll be covering it.
